agency_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SOCIETY OF JASPER
agency_desc: A faith-based organization offering financial assistance, including a thrift store.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SOCIETY - SAINT FRANCIS OF ASSISI
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with rent and utility bills to those in need.
site_details: DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Call to schedule an appointment. Leave voicemail with contact information and need for return call. -- Clients will be directed to the intake location closest to them.
site_eligibility: Living within the Saint Vincent de Paul Society of Jasper network of churches -- Low-income or in financial need, as determined by assessment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a charitable outreach, including food, clothing, and financial assistance to persons in need.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Perishable food may also be available, depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Call before going, worker will bring food out to your car.

site_schedule.name: Rent Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Tues-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Budget Class: Tues 9am -- Nutrition Class: online

site_schedule.name: Transportation Expense Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Tues-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Budget Class: Tues 9am -- Nutrition Class: online

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Tues-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Budget Class: Tues 9am -- Nutrition Class: online

site_eligibility: Living in Spencer County -- Not used this pantry during the previous 30 days
Open
Living in Spencer County -- Low-income, based on assessment -- Participation in both the budget and nutrition classes or skill Assessment
Living in Spencer County -- Low-income, based on assessment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering charitable outreach, including a food pantry and thrift store.
service_description: Sells donated clothing, household goods, furniture, and small appliances at disconnected prices.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open
Not received food from this pantry within the past 14 days

agency_desc: A council on aging agency that provides various activities for area seniors and persons with disabilities.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 55 or older -OR- with a disability of any age

agency_desc: A council on aging agency that provides various activities for area seniors and persons with disabilities.
site_name: SPENCER COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING - MEAL SITE
service_description: Provides nutritious, to-go meals each weekday for area seniors or people with a disability who are SWIRCA eligible. Appointments for meal pickup are required.
site_details: Call to schedule pick up, at least 24 hours in advance.

site_schedule.name: Congregate Meals/Nutrition Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Meal Pickup: Mon-Fri 10am -- by appt only

site_eligibility: Age 55 or older -OR- with a disability of any age -- SWIRCA eligible

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and obtains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Varies by service; serves Spencer County
Open

Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Living in Spencer County -- Age 6 months and older
Varies by service; call for details.
Age 19 or older -- Living in Spencer County
Varies by service
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF SPENCER COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF SPENCER COUNTY
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons in Spencer County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application.
site_eligibility: Open -- Household income between 30%-60% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units to eligible families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications to be placed on the wait list are currently being accepted.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Priority given to persons age 62 or older and/or with disabilities -- Low income

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: LINCOLN HERITAGE PUBLIC LIBRARY - DALE BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs 9am-8pm; Wed and Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs 9am-8pm; Wed and Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-1pm

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Carter, Clay, Grass, Harrison, Huff, or Jackson Township in Spencer County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Spencer County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Spencer County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Varies by service; serves Spencer County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Spencer County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Spencer County

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Spencer County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Spencer County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 3pm

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 3pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make appointment
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a weekly community meal.
service_description: Provides a weekly meal to anyone in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Spencer County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Spencer County Courts

To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Spencer County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Spencer County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Spencer County
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
Spencer County juveniles age 17 and under

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to older adults and those who are disabled in a six county area.
site_name: SWIRCA & MORE MEAL SITE - LINCOLN MANOR
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches five days each week for area seniors. Reservations are not required. Small donation requested.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older (exceptions made for spouses and guests)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children by appointment and on a walk-in basis. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to a schedule an appointment.
